info.title: CDS API for Developers
info.description:
CDS API for Developers. Universal Postal Union
International Bureau
Weltpoststrasse 4
3000 Bern 15
Switzerland CDS API Service Interface

tags.name: Anonymous Declarations
tags.description: Anonymous Declarations are declarations done by end user, before mail acceptance, without being associated yet to a mail item ID.

tags.name: Retrieve data
tags.description: Operational methods used to retrieve data

tags.name: Store data
tags.description: Operational methods used to create data

post.description: Return referral status from mail objects

Transforms an anonymous declaration into a real CDS
declaration so that ITMATT can be sent to the destination post
Converts an amount from a currency type to another
Creates a new blank declaration without storing in the CDS database
Creates a new response without storing in the CDS database
Creates/updates an anonymous declaration
Creates/updates a list of declarations passed as customs data views
Creates/updates a list of responses passed as customs data views

Loads customs data view (status) for a specific item at post.
If the customs response is not available and the forceCreateResponseIfNotAvailable
param is true, the method forces creation of customs response based on the defined auto-response rules

post.summary: Get Decision Name And Category From Code
post.description:
Determines the customs decision name (e.g. item must be presented, item is cleared) and category
(e.g. Hold, clearance, prohibition) from a decision code

post.summary: Get Final Declaration Id From Anonymous Declaration Id
post.description: Searches for the final declaration Id from an anonymous declaration Id
Returns an heartbeat object with the last time of each CDS component was used
Returns the best HS code matches for the given description
Returns restrictions or prohibition for a certain good

post.summary: Get Restriction Prohibition By Description By Country
post.description: Returns restrictions or prohibition for a certain good
Returns restrictions or prohibition for a given list of descriptions

post.summary: Get Restriction Prohibitions By Descriptions By Country
post.description: Returns restrictions or prohibition for a given list of descriptions
Returns restrictions or prohibition for a certain good

post.summary: Get Restriction Prohibition By HS By Country
post.description: Returns restrictions or prohibition for a certain good

Returns the current watchdog information for a given item.
If more than one item with the same itemId is found, the function returns
the most recent item.
Checks if a mail item is prohibited/restricted

Loads customs data views (mail object + declaration + response)
based on a list of criteria passed as parameters.

Loads customs data views (mail object + declaration + response) based on a
list of criteria passed as parameters including the mail state code
Loads a list of marketed goods. Either seller or buyer organization must be provided.

Loads a list of postal services provided by an origin postal
organization to a destination postal organization
Returns a SimpleRefDataCocktail for the language passed as parameter
Authenticate the user and password and return a session token access.
Terminate the authentication session and removes the tempoarary token
Prints CN22 associated with the mail item ID passed as parameter
Prints document associated to customs declaration

Sets the current watchdog information for a new or existing item together
with item's destination, mail class and posting date.
If more than one item with the same itemId is found, an error is thrown.
Stores a declaration to CDS database
Stores a marketed good
Stores a postal service
Stores a response to CDS database
Updates the mail state of the mail object

post.summary: Update Mail State For Transit Items
post.description: Updates the mail state of the mail object

post.summary: Update Mail State and Get Customs Status
post.description: Updates the mail state of the mail object and loads customs data view (status) for a specific item at post (Operational method)

Token.title: Token
Token.description:
The security token used to authorize the web method call.  
The security token must be defined by the CDS administrator at organization level.

CheckItemStatusRequest.title: CheckItemStatusRequest
CheckItemStatusRequest.description: List of MailObjectId, DestinationCountryCd and OriginCountryCd to get current status

Epoch.title: Epoch
Epoch.description:
The epoch (or Unix timestamp) is the number of seconds that have elapsed since January 1, 1970 (midnight UTC/GMT), 
not counting leap seconds.

CheckItemStatusResult.description: List of statuses for all Mail Objects listed on items parameter

ErrorMessage.description: The error message referring the input field which has failed in the validation
ErrorMessage.example: Token not matching the postal organization passed as parameter

ErrorNbr.description: The error number referring the input field which has failed in the validation

ItemId.description: The id of the mail object (when applicable)

anonymousDeclarationId.description: Id of the anonymous declaration (e.g. 9384748AU for an anonymous declaration created at Australia Post)

internationalItemId.description:
The id of the mail object.  If missing, the id of the declaration
will also be the id of the mail item in the ITMATT messages

userCd.description:
The user code that will author the creation of the customs response (if applicable).
If the user code does not exist in CDS, it will be automatically created and linked
to the organization that issued the security token.

officeCd.description: The office code that will author the creation of the customs response (if applicable)

organizationCd.description: The organization code (e.g. AUA - Australia Post) whose defined exchange rates are used for conversion

postalOrgCd.description: The postal organization code (e.g. AUA - Australia Post) were the declarations and responses were created.

customsOrgCd.description:
The customs organization code (e.g. AU - Australia Post Customs)
were the declarations and responses were created.

itemId.description: The id of the mail object

mailFlow.description: Flow of the mail from the point of view of the postal organization

CDSStateCd.description:
State of the declaration (e.g. 1 - new declaration, 2 - draft declaration, 3 - final declaration, 5 - declaration sent to customs
Or state of the response (e.g. 51 - new response, 52 - draft response, 53 - final response, 55 - response sent to post

CustOrganizationCd.description: Code of the customs organization associated to the declaration/response (e.g. AU - Australia Customs)

PostOrganizationCd.description: Code of the postal organization associated to the declaration/response (e.g. AUA - Australia Post)

MarketPlaceUrl.description: Website of the marketplace in the country from which the item is sent

PurchaseOrderNumber.description: Purchase order number assigned by the marketplace to this item

SalesOrderNumber.description: Sales order number assigned by the marketplace to this item as part of the commercial transaction

CurrencyCd.description: Declared amount ISO currency code (e.g. USD, EUR, CAD, etc).

ImportRestrictions.description: List of import restrictions applicable to the content piece

OrigCountryCd.description: ISO country code of mail origin (e.g. AU - Australia, US - United States, CA - Canada, CH - Switzerland, etc)

OtherPartyRole.title: OtherPartyRole
OtherPartyRole.description: Role played by the party in an event or transaction.

x-enumDescriptions.AK: Party to whom delivery notification is to be sent
x-enumDescriptions.CX: Mailee (if specified separately from delivery address)
x-enumDescriptions.FW: Party that determined change of delivery address
x-enumDescriptions.FX: Party to which an entity is handed over
x-enumDescriptions.GC: Neighbour of addressee or similar 3rd party
x-enumDescriptions.HL: Party to receive report / information recipient
x-enumDescriptions.RF: Party from which an entity is received
x-enumDescriptions.TL: Occupant of the delivery address other than the addresee or a relative

OtherPartyAddressLine1.description: The first line of the other party's address

OtherPartyAddressLine2.description: The second line of the other party's address

OtherPartyCountryCd.description: Other party's ISO country code (e.g. AU - Australia, US - United States, CA - Canada, CH - Switzerland, etc).

OtherPartyTypeOfPerson.description: Other party's type (e.g. I - individual person, B - business)

CommercialTransactions.description: List of commercial transactions in declaration.

ContentPieces.description: List of content pieces in declaration

CustomerChargingArrangementCd.description: The duty and tax payment method as it applies to the item.

NatureTransactionReference.description: Item id of the initial shipment in case of an intended return.

GrossWeight.description: Gross weight of the mail in KG.

HandlingClassCd.description: Handling class (e.g. N - ordinaray, V - insured, R - registered)

NatureTypeCd.description:
Nature type of mail (e.g. 21 - returned goods, 31 - gift, 32 - commercial sample,
91 - documents, 991 - mixed content).

NatureTypeDesc.description: Nature type description of mail (only used if NatureTypeCd equal "999 other")

NonDelivInstCd.description: Senders instructions in case of non-delivery (e.g. E1 - Return to sender  priority, E2 - Return to sender  non-priority, K1 - Treat as abandoned).

OrigDutiesAmt.description: Monetary value of duties and taxes as expected by the origin postal operator

OrigDutiesCurrencyCd.description: Currency of duties and taxes as stated by the origin postal operator (e.g. USD, EUR, CAD, etc)

OriginOfficeCd.description: Code of the origin office, where the item was first treated. Usually a postcode.

OriginOfficeNm.description: Name of the origin office, where the item was first treated.

OtherParties.description: List of other parties in declaration

PackageImageSourceInfo.description: Image FTP link (contains URL, FTP user and encrypted FTP password)

PostageCurrencyCd.description: Postage's ISO currency code (e.g. USD, EUR, CAD, etc)

RecipientAddressLine1.description: The first line of the recipient's address

RecipientAddressLine2.description: The second line of the recipient's address

RecipientCity.description:
Recipient's city.
Mandatory for ITMATT 1.5.0 and later generation.

RecipientCountryCd.description: Recipient's ISO country code (e.g. AU - Australia, US - United States, CA - Canada, CH - Switzerland, etc).

RecipientTypeOfPerson.description: Recipient's type (e.g. I - individual person, B - business)

RecipientZIP.description:
Recipient's ZIP code.
Mandatory for ITMATT 1.2.1 generation.

SenderAddressLine1.description: The first line of the sender's address.

SenderAddressLine2.description: The second line of the sender's address

SenderCity.description:
Sender's city.
Mandatory for ITMATT 1.5.0 and later generation.

SenderCountryCd.description: Sender's ISO country code (e.g. AU - Australia, US - United States, CA - Canada, CH - Switzerland, etc).

SenderTypeOfPerson.description: Sender's type (e.g. I - individual person, B - business)

SenderZIP.description:
Sender's ZIP code.
Mandatory for ITMATT 1.2.1 generation.

TransportMode.description: Transport mode (e.g. PL - plane, TK - truck, TR - train, SH - ship)

CreateNewDeclarationResult.description:
The created customs declaration, if flow is not transit 
(the created declaration is not stored to the database)

postalOrgCd.description: The postal organization code (e.g. AUA - Australia Post) were the declarations and responses were created.

customsOrgCd.description:
The customs organization code (e.g. AU - Australia Post Customs)
were the declarations and responses were created.

CurrencyCd.description: Tax ISO currency code (e.g. USD, EUR, CAD, etc).

Description.description: Description of the content piece to which the tax applies

HS.description: HS code of the content piece to which the tax applies

NetWeight.description: Net weight in KG of the content piece to which the tax applies

Number.description: Number of piece's items of the content piece to which the tax applies

DecisionCd.description:
Decision code (e.g. 1 - item must be presented, 2 - item is cleared and does not need to be presented,
3 - item cleared after being checked, 4 - charges raised but customs do not need to see,
5 - refer to other government department, 6 - enforcement, 7 - detention,
8 - item is not allowed in the country, etc)

Dutiable.description: Whether item is dutiable or not

TotalFeeCurrencyCd.description: ISO currency of the total customs fees (e.g. USD, EUR, CAD, etc)

Response-3.title: Response
Response-3.description: Response details from the destination customs (applicable for outbound mail only)

CreateNewResponseResult.description: The created customs response (the created response is not stored to the database)

Id.description: Local declaration identifier (e.g. 2233394CH for a declaration posted in CH)

PostingDt.description: Data and time when the declaration was posted

DCResponse.title: Response
DCResponse.description: Response details from the destination customs (applicable for outbound mail only)

MailCategory.title: MailCategory
MailCategory.description: The mail category of the item

MailClass.title: MailClass
MailClass.description: The mail class of the item

MailFlow.title: MailFlow
MailFlow.description: Flow of the mail from the point of view of the postal organization

MailState.title: MailState
MailState.description: The physical state of the mail

MailObject.title: MailObject
MailObject.description: Mail object details (e.g. item ID, origin, destination, posting date)

DestPostOrgCd.description:
Code of the postal organization of destination (e.g. CAA - Canada Post).
Mandatory for ITMATT generation.

Id.description: International identifier. Mandatory for ITMATT generation.

MailStateRemarks.description:
Free remarks associated to the current physical mail state
(e.g. state = 2 (arrived in OOE), remarks = to be redirected to the surface area)

OrigPostOrgCd.description: Code of the postal organization of origin (e.g. AUA - Australia Post).

CDSView.title: CDSView
CDSView.description:
CDS data facade. Aggregates mail object, declaration, response from customs,
response from destination customs (applicable for outbound mail only)

cdsViews.description:
The list of CDS views. Each CDS view aggregates the mail object details 
(e.g. item id, origin, destination, etc) and the declaration details 
(e.g. sender, recipient, content pieces, etc)

userCd.description:
The user code that will author the creation of the customs response (if applicable).
If the user code does not exist in CDS, it will be automatically created and linked
to the organization that issued the security token.

officeCd.description: The office code that will author the creation of the customs response (if applicable)

cdsViews.description:
The list of CDS views. Each CDS view aggregates the mail object details 
(e.g. item id, origin, destination, etc) and the response details 
(e.g. sender, recipient, content pieces, etc)

userCd.description:
The user code that will author the creation of the customs response (if applicable).
If the user code does not exist in CDS, it will be automatically created and linked
to the organization that issued the security token.

officeCd.description: The office code that will author the creation of the customs response (if applicable)

postalOrgCd.description: The postal organization code (e.g. AUA - Australia Post) were the declarations and responses were created.

id.description: The id of the mail object

flow.description: Flow of the mail from the point of view of the postal organization

forceCreateResponseIfNotAvailable.description:
When true and the appropriate customs response is not available,
CDS will attempt to create a customs response based on the auto-response rules defined in CDS.

userCd.description:
The user code that will author the creation of the customs response (if applicable).
If the user code does not exist in CDS, it will be automatically created and linked
to the organization that issued the security token.

officeCd.description: The office code that will author the creation of the customs response (if applicable)

GetCustomsStatusResult.description: CDSView object that aggregates information about the mail object, customs declaration and customs response

decisionCode.description:
The decision code from customs as contained in the Response object
(e.g. 1 - item must be presented, 2 - item is cleared, etc)

GetDecisionNameAndCategoryFromCodeResult.description:
The first string is the decision name (e.g. item must be prestend, item is cleared)  
and the second string is the decision category: 
- H - hold decision, 
- C - clearance decision, 
- R - rejection/prohibition decision, 
- U - unknown decision
example: Item is not allowed in country

GetFinalDeclarationIdFromAnonymousDeclar.description: The final declaration Id. If not found, returns null

Heartbeat.title: Heartbeat
Heartbeat.description: Heartbeat object with the last time of each CDS component was used

API.description: The most recent log timestamp of the CDS.API component

Service.description: The most recent log timestamp of the CDS.Service component

Web.description: The most recent log timestamp of the CDS.Web component

GetHeartbeatResult.description: Heartbeat object with the last time of each CDS component was used

goodDescription.description:
Description of good (preferable in English. French or Spanish
may be used with lower search efficiency, other languages may be supported on demand)

Observations.description: Additional details such as goods category

GetHSCodesResult.description:
List of HS codes matching the given description with the best match on top or a null object 
if there is no match

destinationPostalOrgCd.description: The postal destination of the good

sendingCountryCd.description: ISO country code of the country where the good is originating from

goodDescription.description: Full or partial description of good in English (use short words, i.e. tobacco)

AdditionalDocFileName.description: Name of the document providing additional information about prohibitions/restrictions

Description.description: Description of the goods subject to prohibition/restriction

FromHSCode.description: Start of the HS range of goods subject to prohibition/restriction

HSCodeList.description: List of HS codes of goods subject to prohibition/restriction

LanguageCd.description: ISO code of the language in which the restriction/prohibition details are provided

OrganizationCd.description: The 3-character organization code of the postal operator owning the restriction/prohibition

RestrictedCountries.description: Countries to which import restrictions apply

ToHSCode.description: End of the HS range of goods subject to prohibition/restriction

Valid.description: Indicates whether the prohibition/restriction is valid or not

WebsiteInfo.description: Link to the web site that provides additional information about prohibitions/restrictions

GetRestrictionProhibitionByDescriptionRe.description:
List of restriction/prohibition articles matching the specified criteria or a null object 
if there is no match (there isn't any known restriction/prohibition)

destinationCountryCd.description: ISO country code of the destination country of the good

sendingCountryCd.description: ISO country code of the country where the good is originating from

goodDescription.description:
Description of good (preferable in English. French or Spanish
may be used with lower search efficiency, other languages may be supported on demand)

GetRestrictionProhibitionByDescriptionBy.description:
List of restriction/prohibition articles matching the specified criteria or a null object 
if there is no match (there isn't any known restriction/prohibition)

destinationPostalOrgCd.description: The postal destination of the good

sendingCountryCd.description: ISO country code of the country where the good is originating from

goodDescriptions.description: List of full or partial description of good in English (use short words, i.e. tobacco)

GetRestrictionProhibitionsByDescriptions.description:
Dictionary having as keys each of the description passed in the list and as value the list 
of restriction/prohibition articles matching the specified description or a null object if 
there is no match (there isn't any known restriction/prohibition)

destinationCountryCd.description: ISO country code of the destination country of the good

sendingCountryCd.description: ISO country code of the country where the good is originating from

goodDescriptions.description: List of full or partial description of good in English (use short words, i.e. tobacco)

GetRestrictionProhibitionsByDescriptions.description:
Dictionary having as keys each of the description passed in the list and as value 
the list of restriction/prohibition articles matching the specified description or 
a null object if there is no match (there isn't any known restriction/prohibition)

destinationPostalOrgCd.description: The postal destination of the good

sendingCountryCd.description: ISO country code of the country where the good is originating from

GetRestrictionProhibitionByHSResult.description:
List of restriction/prohibition articles matching the specified criteria or a null object 
if there is no match (there isn't any known restriction/prohibition)

destinationCountryCd.description: ISO country code of the destination country of the good

sendingCountryCd.description: ISO country code of the country where the good is originating from

GetRestrictionProhibitionByHSByCountryRe.description:
List of restriction/prohibition articles matching the specified criteria or a null object 
if there is no match (there isn't any known restriction/prohibition)

itemId.description: The id of the mail object

WatchdogInfo.title: WatchdogInfo.OperationType
WatchdogInfo.description: Watchdog operation applying to the item

x-enumDescriptions.2: Item is cleared, not on the watchdog list
x-enumDescriptions.4: Item marked as blocked on the watchdog list
x-enumDescriptions.5: Item marked with warning on the watchdog list

Remarks.description: Remarks associated to the current watchdog operation

GetWatchdogItemInfoResult.description: Watchdog information for the required item

mailItemID.description: The mail item ID to which we want to check if it restricted/prohibited

returnRestrictionsProhibitions.description:
To determine if the list of restriction/prohibitions found should be returned.
True to return the list. False not to return the list.

restrictionsProhibitions.description: Dictionary of restriction/prohibitions by mail item content piece description.

originCountryCd.description: ISO country code of the country where the good is originating from (i.e. FR).

destinationCountryCd.description: ISO country code of the country where the good is destined to (i.e. FR).

restrictionsProhibitions.description: Dictionary of restriction/prohibitions by mail item content piece description

postalOrgCd.description: The postal organization code (e.g. AUA - Australia Post) were the declarations and responses were created.

customsOrgCd.description: The customs organization code (e.g. AU - Australia Post Customs) were the declarations and responses were created

organizationTypeCd.description: The type of the organization making the request

id.description: The id of the mail object

partnerPostalOrgCd.description:
The postal organization code of the partner post, that is,
the destination post for the outbound mail and the origin post for the inbound mail.

partCountryCd.description:
The ISO country code of the partner post, that is,
the destination country for the outbound mail and the origin country for the inbound mail.

dtFrom.description: The lower limit of the posting date.

dtTo.description: The upper limit of the posting date.

zipFrom.description:
The lower limit of the ZIP code of the sender, in case of
outbound mail, or recipient, in case of inbound mail.

zipTo.description:
The upper limit of the ZIP code of the sender, in case of
outbound mail, or recipient, in case of inbound mail.

onlyWithoutResponse.description:
If true, the search includes only declarations for which a
customs response hasn't been created yet, otherwise all declarations.

onlyWithDeclarationOrResponse.description:
If true, the search includes only objects that have
either a declaration or a response associated, otherwise all of them.

recordsLimit.description: When specified, the search count is limited to the specified value.

LoadResult.description:
List of customs data views. A customs data view (CDSView) is a class 
that aggregates information about the mail object, customs declaration and customs response

postalOrgCd.description: The postal organization code (e.g. AUA - Australia Post) were the declarations and responses were created.

customsOrgCd.description:
The customs organization code (e.g. AU - Australia Post Customs)
were the declarations and responses were created.

organizationTypeCd.description: The type of the organization making the request

flow.description: Flow of the mail from the point of view of the postal organization

mailStateCd.description: Mail state code (i.e. 1 - received from customer).

MarketedGood-2.title: MarketedGood
MarketedGood-2.description: The marketed good to be stored

origOrganizationCd.description: The origin postal destination of the service

destOrganizationCd.description: The destination postal destination of the service

MailCategoryCd.description: Mail category (e.g. A- Airmail, B - SAL, C - Surface non-prio, D - Surface prio)

MailClassCd.description: Mail class (e.g. E - EMS, C - parcels, U - letters). Mandatory for ITMATT generation.

languageCd.description:
'Language code to get the reference data. Ex: PT (for Portuguese),
FR (for French), ES (for Spanish). If null or not provided, EN (English)
will be used.'

Countries.description: List of country codes that have this currency as official currency.

DecimalPlaces.description: Number of decimal places used in this currency.

SimpleRefDataCocktail.title: SimpleRefDataCocktail
SimpleRefDataCocktail.description: SimpleRefDataCocktail object for the language passed as parameter.

LoadRefDataCocktailResult.description: SimpleRefDataCocktail object for the language passed as parameter

mailItemId.description: The mail item ID to which CN22 is to be printed

userCd.description: The user code that authors the document printing

PrintCustomsDeclarationResult.description: The base64-encoded content of the PDF document

userCd.description:
The user code that will author the creation of the customs response (if applicable).
If the user code does not exist in CDS, it will be automatically created and linked
to the organization that issued the security token.

officeCd.description: The office code that will author the creation of the customs response (if applicable)

PrintDocResult.description: The base64-encoded content of the PDF document

itemId.description: The id of the mail object

destinationPostalOrgCd.description:
The postal destination of the good (i.e. AUA, FRA, etc.).
If this parameter is null and the item does not yet exist in CDS, a ZZZ value is assumed.

mailClassCd.description:
The mail class (e.g. E - EMS, U - Letters, C - Parcels).
If this parameter is null and the item does not yet exist in CDS,
the mail class will be determined from the itemId.

postingDate.description:
The posting date.  If this parameter is null and the item does not yet exist
in CDS, the current date/time will be used as posting date.

watchdogInfo.description: Watchdog information for the specified item

evtCd.description: The event code against which the declaration is stored

userCd.description:
The user code that will author the creation of the customs response (if applicable).
If the user code does not exist in CDS, it will be automatically created and linked
to the organization that issued the security token.

officeCd.description: The office code that will author the creation of the customs response (if applicable)

marketedGood.description: The marketed good to be stored

postalService.description: The postal service to be stored

evtCd.description: The event code against which the declaration is stored

userCd.description:
The user code that will author the creation of the customs response (if applicable).
If the user code does not exist in CDS, it will be automatically created and linked
to the organization that issued the security token.

officeCd.description: The office code that will author the creation of the customs response (if applicable)

id.description: The id of the mail object

postalOrgCd.description: The postal organization code (e.g. AUA - Australia Post) were the declarations and responses were created.

flow.description: Flow of the mail from the point of view of the postal organization

mailState.description: The state of the mail item

userCd.description:
The user code that will author the creation of the customs response (if applicable).
If the user code does not exist in CDS, it will be automatically created and linked
to the organization that issued the security token.

id.description: The id of the mail object

postalOrgCd.description: The postal organization code (e.g. AUA - Australia Post) were the declarations and responses were created.

flow.description: Flow of the mail from the point of view of the postal organization

mailState.description: The state of the mail item

itemDestPostalOrgCd.description: The item destination postal organization code. Mandatory when flow is T (transit).

userCd.description:
The user code that will author the creation of the customs response (if applicable).
If the user code does not exist in CDS, it will be automatically created and linked
to the organization that issued the security token.

id.description: The id of the mail object

postalOrgCd.description: The postal organization code (e.g. AUA - Australia Post) were the declarations and responses were created.

flow.description: Flow of the mail from the point of view of the postal organization

mailState.description: The state of the mail item

forceCreateResponseIfNotAvailable.description:
When true and the appropriate customs response is not available, CDS will attempt to create 
a customs response based on the auto-response rules defined in CDS. Mandatory parameter

itemDestPostalOrgCd.description: The item destination postal organization code. Mandatory when flow is T (transit)

userCd.description:
The user code that will author the creation of the customs response (if applicable).
If the user code does not exist in CDS, it will be automatically created and linked
to the organization that issued the security token.

officeCd.description: The office code that will author the creation of the customs response (if applicable)

UpdateMailStateAndGetCustomsStatusResult.description: CDSView object that aggregates information about the mail object, customs declaration and customs response
